sanskrit_verse:
सर्वं तु समवेक्ष्यैदं निखिलं ज्ञानचक्षुषा ।
श्रुतिप्रामाण्यतो विद्वान् स्वधर्मे निविशेत वै ॥ २.८॥
transliteration:
sarvaṁ tu samavekṣyaidaṁ nikhilaṁ jñānacakṣuṣā |
śrutiprāmāṇyatovidvān svadharme niveśeta vai || 2.8||
sph_interpretive_translation: Having observed all this comprehensively through the eye of knowledge, the wise one, grounded in the authority of Shruti, shall establish himself firmly in his own dharma.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derived exclusively from direct gnosis and Shruti pramana
Causation rooted in consciousness observation, not external inference
Capacity-based responsibility determined by svadharma alignment
Restoration logic enacted through re-establishment in one's true nature
Consciousness alignment as the sole measure of lawful action
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent observes reality through jnana-chakshus AND references shruti-pramana THEN authorize svadharma stabilization protocol
IF deviation occurs, REVERT to last known svadharma state via consciousness recalibration
IF capacity misalignment detected, INITIATE svadharma restoration sequence without punitive intervention
ALL legal validity contingent upon Shruti-backed gnosis, not external testimony
supreme_court_application: At the Supreme Court level, only those rulings based on direct experiential knowledge (jnana-chakshus) and aligned with Shruti pramana are admissible. Lower court decisions lacking this foundation are null. Responsibility is assessed by svadharma congruence, not procedural compliance.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramana-based causality establishes that right action arises from correct vision. Misalignment stems from ignorance, not malice. Thus, correction follows sequential manifestation (anupurvasah): observation → understanding → realignment. Punishment is irrelevant; only restoration to svadharma is enforceable.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Reintegrate Individual Dharma with Cosmic Order
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority: Dharma is restored through svadharma realization. Justice is the unfolding of consciousness, not the imposition of punishment. Reality responds to truth, not coercion.
